Presidents Jimmy Carter ( 45.3 percent), Ronald Reagan ( 43.3 percent) and Bill Clinton ( 45.9 percent) had lower approval rating averages during their second years in office, Gallup reports. Barack Obama 's low second-year ratings are due in large part to the struggles of the U.S. economy, Jeffrey M. Jones wrote for Gallup.`` The other presidents with low second-year averages also took office during difficult economic times.
